channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Boeing sweetens labor proposal in 'best and final' offer as strike enters second week
item.description: The new offer includes higher pay raises, reinstated annual bonuses and an increased ratification bonus, among other changes, Boeing said on its website.

item.title: Luxury stocks slip as fears grow of a prolonged downturn
item.description: "The luxury goods industry could be in for a prolonged period of weakness, we've already seen it for a couple of semesters."

item.title: Britain's finance minister calls for spending discipline but no return to austerity
item.description: U.K. Finance Minister Rachel Reeves vowed on Monday that Britain will not return to austerity, saying her budget proposals will look to rebuild the country.

item.title: These are the 3 patterns of the ‘chronically single,’ says breakup expert
item.description: Amy Chan, 42, is the author of "Breakup Bootcamp: The Science of Rewiring Your Heart." She brought in over $200,000 in 2023 with her business.

item.title: Japan is pushing a 4-day working week — but its workaholic culture makes it a hard sell
item.description: Japan has ramped up its push for companies to adopt a four-day workweek, but those efforts face steep challenges in a country famous for its workaholic culture.

item.title: Gen Z and millennials are increasingly ‘doom spending.' Here's what it is and how to stop it
item.description: 'Doom spending' is taking off among young people, as life goals such as owning a home or starting a family feel increasingly out of reach.

item.title: Battery giant Northvolt to cut 25% of workforce in Sweden as part of a major cost-cutting drive
item.description: Battery maker Northvolt on Monday announced plans to cut a total of 1,600 jobs in Sweden as part of a major cost-cutting drive.

item.title: UniCredit boosts its stake in Commerzbank, applies to own up to 29.9% of the German bank
item.description: UniCredit announced it had increased its stake in German lender Commerzbank to 21% and submitted a request to boost the holding to up to 29.9%.

item.title: U.S. billionaire Dan Friedkin agrees to buy EPL soccer club Everton
item.description: The deal is subject to subject to regulatory approval from the EPL, the Football Association, and Britain's Financial Conduct Authority.

item.title: Europe careens toward a downturn as its biggest economies fight crises at home
item.description: With both Germany and France fighting political and economic woes, analysts say there's a danger of a leadership vacuum and more fragmentation.

item.title: Trump Media plummets 10% as post-lockup selloff picks up steam
item.description: Donald Trump is the majority owner of Trump Media, which owns social media platform Truth Social and trades as DJT on the Nasdaq.

item.title: Judge orders would-be Trump assassin Ryan Routh held without bail
item.description: Ryan Routh left a witness a box containing a handwritten note that said, “This was an assassination attempt on Donald Trump but I failed you."

item.title: A stunning sterling rally is about to collide with Britain's political realities
item.description: The pound's rally on the back of the Bank of England communication "looks fully justified," Chris Turner, global head of markets at ING, said.

item.title: India rules out joining world’s largest trade deal, accuses China of 'very opaque' trade practices
item.description: The RCEP is the world's largest free trade agreement by GDP of its members.

item.title: China stimulus calls are growing louder — inside and outside the country
item.description: The world's second-largest economy has remained under pressure from a real estate slump and tepid consumer confidence.

item.title: China's youth unemployment hits fresh high amid economic slowdown and restrictive hiring policies
item.description: The jobless rate for people in China ages 16 to 24, and not in school, rose to 18.8% last month. That's up from 17.1% in July, and 13.2% in June.

item.title: TSMC and Samsung in talks with UAE to build chip megafactories, WSJ reports
item.description: Discussions are still in the early stages, according to the outlet.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Some aren’t convinced of a soft landing
item.description: Last week’s burst of euphoria was mostly driven by anticipation and celebration of the Fed’s rate cut. Markets this week will look at the hard data coming out.

item.title: Middle Eastern funds are plowing billions of dollars into hottest AI start-ups
item.description: Oil-rich nations are turning from oil to artificial intelligence to diversify their economies.

item.title: Intel's wild week leaves Wall Street more uncertain than ever about chipmaker's future
item.description: Intel still makes the majority of processors at the heart of PCs, laptops, and servers, but that's not enough to appease investors.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Recession concerns still linger
item.description: Last week’s burst of euphoria was mostly driven by anticipation and celebration of the Fed’s rate cut. Markets this week will look at the hard data coming out.

item.title: Why EU tariffs are unlikely to dent Chinese EV makers' European expansion
item.description: To make the European market unattractive for Chinese EV exports, tariffs have to be as high as 50%, according to research group Rhodium.

item.title: Britain's ultra-wealthy are threatening to exit en masse ahead of proposed tax changes
item.description: Labour's plans to axe the U.K.'s non-dom tax regime could spark an ultra wealthy exodus, advisers and research bodies have warned.

item.title: House Speaker Johnson axes Trump voting restrictions in new government funding bill
item.description: Congressional Democrats and Republicans have eight days to strike a funding deal before the government goes into a partial shutdown.

item.title: Qualcomm recently approached Intel about a possible takeover
item.description: If Qualcomm were to acquire Intel, it would be one of the largest technology deals on record, but would first invite hefty regulatory scrutiny.

item.title: Harris raised 4 times more than Trump in donations for final election sprint
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris also raised $47 million in the 24 hours after the debate against Donald Trump.

item.title: Indian ed-tech startup Physics Wallah bags $2.8 billion valuation amid sector troubles
item.description: Physics Wallah CEO Alakh Pandey said the company would use the $210 million funding to expand its business and do acquisitions.

item.title: American Airlines in talks to pick Citigroup over rival bank Barclays for crucial credit card deal, sources say
item.description: American has been working with banks and card networks on a new deal with the aim of consolidating its business with a single issuer, sources tell CNBC.

item.title: Trump Media closes at a new 52-week low on heavy trading after lockup expires
item.description: Former President Donald Trump's majority stake in the Truth Social owner was worth $1.5 billion by Friday's close.

item.title: Apple iPhone 16, Apple Watch Series 10 and AirPods 4 debut around the world
item.description: Apple greeted customers at its stores around the world on Friday, for the debuts of the iPhone 16, Apple Watch Series 10 and AirPods 4.
